data.title: Official Athletics Website
data.meta_description: Zack Randolph (36) C - 2014: Hit .250 in 28 games with 10 RBIs, nine runs, five walks and two stolen bases • Started 15 games at catcher, with the team ...
data.text:
2014: Hit .250 in 28 games with 10 RBIs, nine runs, five walks and two stolen bases • Started 15 games at catcher, with the team going 10-5 during those contests • Bulldogs went 10-3 when Randolph recorded a hit • Threw out two runners attempting to steal • Went 5-for-9 (.556) with runners on third and less than two outs • Recorded four multiple-hit games and drove in multiple runs on two occasions • Hit .308 in non-conference action • Reached base safely in nine-straight games from March 15-April 15, hitting safely in five-consecutive contests from March 21-29 • Tied a career high with two hits April 26 vs. Texas A&M, scoring one run • Threw out his second base runner of the season April 20 in the win at Missouri • Hit .333 with a walk in two starts at No. 9 LSU April 4-6 • Dealt the knockout blow to Arkansas March 29 in game two of the series, cranking a two-run single to the gap in left in an eventual 5-1 victory • Scored the walk-off run against Southeast Missouri March 25, collecting a career-high tying two hits and two runs in the process • Tallied a career-high three RBIs in the televised win against No. 3 Vanderbilt March 21 • Walked, stole second and scored twice in the first game of a doubleheader sweep at Georgia March 15 • Drove in a run in three-straight appearances Feb. 25-March 9 • Knocked out a career-high two hits off the bench March 9 in the win at Arizona • Recorded his first MSU hit Feb. 15 vs. Western Carolina • Made his MSU debut as the Opening Day starter at catcher Feb. 14 vs. Western Carolina • Member of the 2014 SEC Spring Academic Honor Roll.

2013: Redshirted his first year on campus • Member of the 2013 SEC First-Year Academic Honor Roll • Played for the Golden Triangle Jets of the Cotton States League in summer ball.

JUNIOR COLLEGE: Solid defensive receiver during a two-year career at Itawamba (Miss.) Community College • Coached by Ricky Collier • Earned First-Team MACJC All-State honors in 2012 after ranking third on the club with a .370 batting average • Tied for second on the team with 11 doubles and ranked third with 26 RBIs • fashioned a .433 on-base percentage in helping spark the Indians to a 39-13 record, the 2012 north division title and a berth in the Region 23 Tournament • Hit .283 and knocked in 15 runs his rookie campaign at Itawamba CC • Retired 22-of-27 basestealers and compiled a .961 fielding percentage.

HIGH SCHOOL: Three-year catching standout at Amory High School • Coached by Chad Williams • Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal Player of the Year • Batted .366 as a senior in 2010 with 20 walks and a .514 on-base percentage • Legged out eight doubles and two triples while driving in 15 runs • Compiled a sterling .990 fielding percentage and retired nine of the 12 baserunners • Three-time defensive MVP • Hails from the same high school program that produced teammate Will Cox, MSU associate head coach Butch Thompson and former Bulldog and current Texas Rangers’ first baseman Mitch Moreland.

PERSONAL: Born Zachary James Randolph on March 30, 1992 in Amory, Miss. • Son of Lora and Ken Randolph • Majoring in kinesiology.
